wiki.summary: “Bank Account” sees 21 Savage rapping about his wealth amongst other things over a dark beat produced by Metro Boomin and 21 Savage himself. The track samples Coleridge-Taylor Perkinson’s 1974 song “Flashbulbs,” a sample also used on Travis Scott’s “Oh My Dis Side.” On the 10th of November the music video was released, starring comedian Mike Epps and directed by Matt Swinsky. “Bank Account” peaked at #12 on the Billboard Hot 100. Read more on Last.fm.
wiki.content: “Bank Account” sees 21 Savage rapping about his wealth amongst other things over a dark beat produced by Metro Boomin and 21 Savage himself. The track samples Coleridge-Taylor Perkinson’s 1974 song “Flashbulbs,” a sample also used on Travis Scott’s “Oh My Dis Side.” On the 10th of November the music video was released, starring comedian Mike Epps and directed by Matt Swinsky. “Bank Account” peaked at #12 on the Billboard Hot 100. It also peaked at #4 on Billboard’s Hot Rap Songs and #5 Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs charts. On March 31, 2021, “Bank Account” officially went RIAA 6x Platinum, being certified for 6,000,000 unit sales. Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.
